definition: perfect and without blemish/flawless/to leave nothing to be desired
to finish/to be over/whole/complete/entire
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
deficiency/lack/scarce/vacant post/to run short of

sentences.english: He is perfect as the sensitive but strong reporter.
sentences.chinese: 他把一個敏感而言詞犀利的記者演得完美無缺。

sentences.english: You essence is as pure and perfect as an unblemished jewel .
sentences.chinese: 你的本質如同無瑕的珠寶一樣完美無缺。
德式設計是否完美無缺？

sentences.english: This protects from data loss, but it's not always perfect either.
sentences.chinese: 這個選項能夠避免數據損失，但它並不總是完美無缺。

sentences.english: Certainly, the theory of finnis is by no means perfect.
sentences.chinese: 當然，菲尼斯的理論並非完美無缺。

sentences.english: A good brandy completes a fine meal.
sentences.chinese: 喝點好白蘭地酒才使一頓佳餚完美無缺。

sentences.english: Her flawless performance won rave reviews from the critics.
sentences.chinese: 她完美無缺的表演贏得劇評家的大力稱讚。

sentences.english: In mrs. dashwood's estimation he was as faultless as in marianne's .
sentences.chinese: 達什伍德太太同瑪麗安一樣，也認爲他是完美無缺的。

sentences.english: We should enjoy nature and its flawlessness. We should understand the beauty of life.
sentences.chinese: 全然欣賞這完美無缺的世界，瞭解無常生命裏的美。

sentences.english: Only with this perfect organization, we have a whale of good time.
sentences.chinese: 晚會組織的完美無缺，令人盡興盡致。

sentences.english: As I say, none of us is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 就像我講的，沒有人是完美無缺的。

sentences.english: The party was perfectly organized and I enjoyed every minute of it.
sentences.chinese: 晚會組織得完美無缺，令人盡興盡致。

sentences.english: We don't claim that our decis'ions are per'fect.
sentences.chinese: 不能說我們的決定就是完美無缺的。

sentences.english: It could no longer be said that the moon was perfect.
sentences.chinese: 沒人能再說月亮是完美無缺的了。

sentences.english: I want you to make up with her. I want you to be the perfect loving husband.
sentences.chinese: 我要你同她和好，當一個完美無缺的愛妻子的丈夫。

sentences.english: Being happy doesn't have to mean that everything is perfect but rather you are looking beyond the imperfections.
sentences.chinese: 開心並非是指事事完美無缺，而是你不再抱殘守缺。

definition: consciousness
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
untainted by even a speck of dust (idiom); selfless and incorruptible/spotless
there is no difference/it makes no difference
to turn a blind eye to
excellent in every respect/flawless
hard to distinguish real from imitation
authentic
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
survival of the fittest
optimism
to dispute/to refute
